instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_TDI: What is SMC_TDI? SMC_TDI is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc mode burned probe points
threads.message:
I have a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. When I plugged in the charger for the first time it spun for a couple seconds then turned off. The fan no longer spins at all when I plug the charger in.
The I/O board looked to have some damage to it so I tried with a new one and still the same issue. When I took the board out the only liquid damage I could find was by the SMC.

I removed the edge bonding completely put some flux and heated the area. I see that the 4 SMC modes (<SIGNAL>SMC_TDI</SIGNAL>, TDO, TDS, TCK and <SIGNAL>SMC_INT_L</SIGNAL>) and the probe points next to them are gone. 
I try putting some solder on the point but there is no pad so the solder is not sticking. Also there is no continuity from the probe point to the resistor.

In order to repair this do I just scratch at the traces and run a wire to the resistors?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc mode burned probe points
threads.message: Those pins can be left unconnected and it should work just fine. I'm not sure about <SIGNAL>SMS_INT_L</SIGNAL> though, that may need fixing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc mode burned probe points
threads.message: Thank you. The machine booted up fine without having to do any repairs to it.
